Class PlayerCharacter

  • java.lang.Object
    • PlayerCharacter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Fighter, Mage, Priest, Rogue

    public abstract class PlayerCharacter
extends java.lang.Object
    This class will detail the basic framework of a character. These attributes are common to all classes (though in the case of the fighter and rogue, magic will always be at 0), but will have different growth rates and abilities depending upon the class.
    Author:
    Matt Hendrick

    • Method Detail

      • levelUp

        public void levelUp()
        This is how the character will grow upon reaching a certain experience point threshold. There is code that will level the character multiple times in the very rare event a character gains more than one level in a single battle.

      • abilityType

        public void abilityType()
        This is the general skeleton of what an ability would look like. Since most of the abilities manipulate damage and defense in some way, those two parameters are included in the general method. All abilities have a required level and a name.

      • setCharName

        public void setCharName(java.lang.String name)
        Parameters:
        name - Sets the character's name after creation

      • getCharName

        public java.lang.String getCharName()
        Returns:
        This will call the character's name when needed

      • setCharStr

        public void setCharStr(int str)
        Parameters:
        str - Sets the character's strength to the current value. May be manipulated by abilities also.

      • getCharStr

        public int getCharStr()
        Returns:
        Will call the strength value when needed, often during battles.

      • setCharDex

        public void setCharDex(int dex)
        Parameters:
        dex - Sets the character's dexterity to the current value. May be manipulated by abilities as well.

      • getCharDex

        public int getCharDex()
        Returns:
        Will call the dexterity value when needed, often during battles.

      • setCharCon

        public void setCharCon(int con)
        Parameters:
        con - Sets the character's constitution to the current value. May be manipulated by abilities as well.

      • getCharCon

        public int getCharCon()
        Returns:
        Will call the constitution value when needed, often during battles and when calculating HP.

      • setCharMind

        public void setCharMind(int mind)
        Parameters:
        mind - Sets the character's intelligence to the current value.

      • getCharMind

        public int getCharMind()
        Returns:
        Will call the intelligence value when needed, often during battles when casting magic.

      • setCharHealth

        public void setCharHealth(int hp)
        Parameters:
        hp - Sets the character's health to the current value, though never in the negatives.

      • getCharHealth

        public int getCharHealth()
        Returns:
        Will call the HP value when needed, often during battles or when taking curative items.

      • setCharMagic

        public void setCharMagic(int mp)
        Parameters:
        mp - Sets the character's magic to the current value though never in the negatives.

      • getCharMagic

        public int getCharMagic()
        Returns:
        Will call the MP value when needed, often during battles or when taking items to recover it.

      • setExperience

        public void setExperience(int exp)
        Parameters:
        exp - Adds the enemy's experience value to the player's total

      • getExperience

        public int getExperience()
        Returns:
        Will call the experience value when needed, often after battles.

      • setCurrency

        public void setCurrency(int gold)
        Parameters:
        gold - Adds and subtracts money when needed

      • getCurrency

        public int getCurrency()
        Returns:
        Will call the currency value when needed, typically after a battle or when shopping
